title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 3791/87 of 17 December 1987 on the classification of goods under heading No 87.10 of the Common Customs Tariff
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 3791/87
of 17 December 1987
on the classification of goods under heading No 87.10 of the Common Customs Tariff
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Cyclocross bicycles for children comprising a closed frame of metal tubes, with a height of 28 cm (distance between the centre of the pedal axle and the seat pillar clamp), equipped with wheels with a diameter of between 30 and 50 cm (12 to 20 inches), with pedal and wheel axles fitted with ball-bearings and with a low fixed gear ratio are included under the following heading of the Common Customs Tariff:
87.10 cycles (including delivery tricycles), not motorized.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the eighth day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 17 December 1987.
For the Commission
COCKFIELD
Vice-President
